H0.text: Cold temperatures are the kind of weather that psychrophiles need to grow and reproduce.

H1.text: Mixed temperatures are the kind of weather that psychrophiles need to grow and reproduce.

H2.text: Hot temperatures are the kind of weather psychrophiles need to grow and reproduce.

H3.text: Water temperatures are the kind of weather that psychrophiles need to grow and reproduce.

A4.text: Psychrophiles are extremophilic organisms that are capable of growth and reproduction in low temperatures, ranging from −20 °C to 20 °C.

A5.text: They are present in permafrost, polar ice, glaciers, snowfields and deep ocean waters.

A6.text: Psychrophilic and psychrotolerant microorganisms were isolated in cold rooms used for pharmaceutical processing.

A7.text: Genome-wide expression analysis of yeast response during exposure to 4C.
